name: Editing Literary Texts
description: Students will learn the basics of literary editing for different readerships: the course will cover such topics as the selection of a base text; treatment of variants; creation of paratext; design and layout; proofs and proofchecking; and the differences between print and digital media. [36L]
prerequisites: 1.0 credit in ENG and 3.0 additional credits; or ENG289H5/ENG291H5.
